metadata.Description: The Global Energy Efficiency Strategy is an initiative aimed at promoting energy-saving practices across various sectors worldwide to reduce energy consumption, lower greenhouse gas emissions, and support sustainable development.

Global Energy Efficiency Strategy.Description: The strategy targets building efficiency improvements through standards and technology upgrades that reduce energy use and operational costs.
It enhances industrial efficiency by promoting cleaner and more efficient technologies and processes in manufacturing and production sectors.
The strategy reforms transport efficiency by supporting the transition to electric vehicles and improving public transport networks.
It influences consumer behavior towards more energy-efficient practices through education and incentives.
The strategy develops comprehensive policies that foster a regulatory environment conducive to energy efficiency.
The strategy is endorsed by the SEH as a critical component of sustainable energy transition.
IRENA supports this strategy as part of its efforts to increase global energy efficiency in conjunction with renewable energy adoption.
